title: Link to failed test screenshot in Test Details Modal
description:
### Problem to Solve

[Sasha](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sasha-software-developer) and the team have worked to create browser tests using [Selenium and Webdriver.io](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/ci/examples/end_to_end_testing_webdriverio/#selenium-and-webdriverio). Today those tests capture a screenshot as an artifact at failure to help troubleshoot the test issue. Sasha has to dig through the logs and screenshots stored as artifacts to find the failures which takes too long and is done outside of the GitLab UI.

### Intended users

* [Sasha](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sasha-software-developer)
* QE/SDET

### Further details

This is the first iteration of this larger feature.

### Proposal

#### Product proposal
* ~~Create a new tab on the pipeline page called screenshots.~~ - In favor of a simpler MVP there will be a new entry on the details modal.
* Display the attachment name associated with the failed test and a link to the attachment.
* ~~Add tracking to capture page views of the tab so we can measure success of the feature.~~ Will be done in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/258661

#### Technical Proposal

- Edit [the test_case_details.vue file](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/4060f50fb1adf814e7c34a7d1c3bafb2059bbc4f/app/assets/javascripts/pipelines/components/test_reports/test_case_details.vue#L79-80) to include an attachment URL spot.
- Edit [the test_case_details_spec.js file](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/fa456fe2971aa0b66091c08c71cc9dbe571763ab/spec/frontend/pipelines/test_reports/test_case_details_spec.js#L62-63) to check that the URL is rendered.

#### Design

N/A for the MVC the file will be a link to the file.

### Permissions and Security

* editing the gitlab-ci.yml should follow project guidelines, this requires no special permissions
* viewing and downloading the data requires no special permissions

### Documentation

This will need a new page in the docs to instruct users:

* How to create junit xml that is detected and how to setup artifacts that are discoverable by the feature
* Where to see the report
* How long the artifacts persist
* Common troubleshooting tips if the report fails (like if you need two MRs before the report appears, etc.)

### Testing

* test for performance with many (1000's) of screenshots
* test for junit is present but screenshot is missing

### What does success look like, and how can we measure that?

We will measure success by [tracking views of the screenshots tab](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/258661). Since this does not yet exist we will establish a baseline at 30 days after launch and iterate towards improvements.

### What is the type of buyer?

The buyer for this is a manager who is trying to make life easier for a team who is doing some automated browser testing and having issues with identifying why those tests are failing.

### Links / references

[gitlab#18850](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues/18850)

title: Direct links to design management images are not rendered properly in markdown
description:
### Summary

A URL to a design management image like this: `https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/39467/designs/releases__milestone.png` gets rendered in markdown like this: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/39467/designs/releases__milestone.png.

Clicking on the link navigates to the issue with a "Could not find design" error message:

![Screen_Shot_2020-05-07_at_11.31.13_AM](/uploads/5cf9091e453808f9a975b3dff3a6d2c8/Screen_Shot_2020-05-07_at_11.31.13_AM.png)

This is because the link does not include the `.png` extension.

### Steps to reproduce

Paste a link like `https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/39467/designs/releases__milestone.png` into an issue comment and submit the comment.

### Output of checks

This bug happens on GitLab.com.

### Links

Possibly related to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/12905 and/or https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/216503.

title: Geo - Support Parameterized Routing for Replication
description:
## What/Why

Follow up for https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/30890#note_337811884

We introduced a new routing paradigm for Geo Replication in the above MR:

| proposal | routes |
| ------ | ------ |
| **New Redirect** | `admin/geo/replication` => `admin/geo/replication/projects` |
| **New Route** | `admin/geo/replication/projects` |
| **New Route** | `admin/geo/replication/uploads` |
| **New Route** | `admin/geo/replication/designs` |

However, these routes are "hard-coded" and any new replicable items will need to be manually added. This will need to be changed to assist with fully supporting Geo Self Service.

Currently in the api we are already supporting a param called `:replicable_name`.  It would be nice to use this here too.

## Proposal
*  Replace the routing above with a parameterized route. Ex: `admin/geo/replication/:replicable_name`
*  Require 0 additional code to support a route once a new replicable type is added via Self Service
*  **future consideration:** Auto populate the nav with new replicable type when added via Self-Service => https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/219315

epic.title: Geo: Implement frontend for Self-Service Framework replicables

title: Add an expandable tag detail view to the Image Repository Detail View UI
description:
<!-- The first four sections: "Problem to solve", "Intended users", "User experience goal", and "Proposal", are strongly recommended, while the rest of the sections can be filled out during the problem validation or breakdown phase. However, keep in mind that providing complete and relevant information early helps our product team validate the problem and start working on a solution. -->

### Problem to solve

The Package stage allows you to publish, consume, and discover images, all in one place. Users publish and pull images using GitLab CI/CD, the command line, or the GitLab API. 

Often, users would like to understand more detail about a specific tag but currently there isn't a good way to view these details in the user interface.

### Intended users

Personas are described at https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/

* [Delaney (Development Team Lead)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#delaney-development-team-lead)
* [Sasha (Software Developer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sasha-software-developer)
* [Devon (DevOps Engineer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#devon-devops-engineer)
* [Sidney (Systems Administrator)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sidney-systems-administrator)
* [Rachel (Release Manager)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#rachel-release-manager) 

### User experience goal

Improve the experience surrounding understanding specific image tag details.

### Proposal

Add an expandable detail view (similar to the commit message on the commit UI) that allows users to see more details around a tag, including the specific image repository, date, time, and the manifest ID.

| Image Repository list view with closed details |
|---|
| ![Add_the_detail_expansion_UI_component](/uploads/a0cce0bcffa41264261fa51681a69a57/Add_the_detail_expansion_UI_component.png) |

|---|
| ![Add_the_detail_expansion_UI_component__OPEN](/uploads/8ab97ad5b3620e63a69fc1dda7028283/Add_the_detail_expansion_UI_component__OPEN.png) |

### Further details

The major focus of this issue is to create the UI moment of an expandable tag detail view. More tag related details will be added including CI/CD Details, Retention Policy expiration schedule, and security scanning results.

title: Add performance marks and measures (User Timing API) to MR Diffs for relevant moments
description:
<!-- The first four sections: "Problem to solve", "Intended users", "User experience goal", and "Proposal", are strongly recommended, while the rest of the sections can be filled out during the problem validation or breakdown phase. However, keep in mind that providing complete and relevant information early helps our product team validate the problem and start working on a solution. -->

### Problem to solve

We are currently unable to track the timing of the events beyond the generic ones ([Example](https://storage.googleapis.com/sitespeed-results-gitlab/gitlab.com/2020-02-27-00-22-14/pages.html)).

We'd like to be able to tell whether a change has affected the performance of any given part of the lifecycle of the MR Diffs app.

Per the discussion on https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/frontend/rfcs/-/issues/51, it's pretty clear we will go forward with this and we're now waiting for a final decision on the How? — In regards to the naming and eventually how to actually write it consistently.

We should start by taking stock and identifying the relevant moments we'd like to see the timings tracked. Later we will create an issue to add all the marks identified in this issue to the app.

### User experience goal

Have a clear list of marks to be added to the MR Diffs app.

### Proposal

Contribute in the discussion of this issue to compile a table of meaningful marks and measurements we'd like to have timings of.

#### Marks

| Keyword | Description |
| ------ | ------ |
|  |  |

#### Measurements

| Title | Mark Start | Mark End | Description |
| ------ | ------ | ------ | ------ |
| | | |  | 


Not just absolute timings, but we'd be able to calculate deltas between two marks with measurements.

### Further details

For more details on the context of this effort, see https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/frontend/rfcs/-/issues/51

### Availability & Testing

We haven't assessed how we are going to tackle testing here, yet. Contributions welcome.

title: Project Import uses Issue attachment upload limits
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "regression" or "bug" label:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=regression
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=bug

and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

When using workhorse, Project import **via the UI** uses the setting `Gitlab::CurrentSettings.max_attachment_size` which the user can set in the admin settings: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/8160ad36/app/controllers/import/gitlab_projects_controller.rb#L41-41

`.../admin/application_settings/general`
![Screen_Shot_2020-05-07_at_1.20.04_PM](/uploads/8d8ce4a4a55c7f43c9a8409a9cf51481/Screen_Shot_2020-05-07_at_1.20.04_PM.png)


This setting should govern the max attachment size for attachments to entities like issues, not to the entire size of the export. In the Project import API, we use a constant of `50 megabytes` instead: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/8160ad36/lib/api/project_import.rb#L7-7

We should align both these endpoints to use the same value, and not base this on the attachment size.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Export a project with a size larger than 10mb
1. Try to import to an instance that is using object store and direct uploads

### What is the current *bug* behaviour?

When uploading a gitlab import file via the UI, the response is `"error": "entity is too large"`

### What is the expected *correct* behaviour?

The user can upload an export file via the UI that is the same size as a file they can upload via the API. In this case, that would be up to `50 megabytes`.

### Workarounds

1. Increase the maximum attachment size while doing the importing
1. Import the project via the API instead

### Problem to solve

The Package stage allows you to publish, consume, and discover images, all in one place. Users publish and pull images using GitLab CI/CD, the command line, or the GitLab API. 

When users have long tag names, or a large number of tags, the current table view is often cumbersome to work within. 

### Intended users

Personas are described at https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/

* [Delaney (Development Team Lead)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#delaney-development-team-lead)

* [Rachel (Release Manager)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#rachel-release-manager) 

### User experience goal

Improve the experience of viewing the tags held inside an image repository.

### Proposal

Convert the current UI from using the table UI component over to the list view component.

| Image repository detail view |
|---|

Users have often mentioned some initial confusion on the disabled multi-select delete button. After introducing the image repository delete button the "Delete selected" verbiage will also help clarify the different delete utilities.

title: Make Retire.js ignore local dependencies
description:
### Problem to solve

Dependency Scanning fails when scanning a npm project that has local dependencies, making impossible to scan such projects. It should report a warning instead, and scan all remote dependencies.

This has been originally reported as ~bug issue in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/33323. cc @nfriend 

### Intended users

### User experience goal

<!-- What is the single user experience workflow this problem addresses? 
For example, "The user should be able to use the UI/API/.gitlab-ci.yml with GitLab to <perform a specific task>"
https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/ux/ux-research-training/user-story-mapping/ --> 

### Proposal

- [ ] Update [retire.js](https://github.com/RetireJS/retire.js) so that it doesn't fail when [`notInstalled.length > 0` is true](https://github.com/RetireJS/retire.js/blob/1aba081b5d5363add13710edeb470d5eb4f3c914/node/lib/resolve.js#L62), but report a warning instead.
- [ ] Open a Pull Request in upstream project [retire.js](https://github.com/RetireJS/retire.js) to implement this change.
- [ ] Bump to a new version of `retire.js` if the PR is accepted, else fork the project or patch when building the Docker image, in the [analyzer/retire.js](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/retire.js) project. 

### Further details
 
[analyzer/retire.js](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/analyzers/retire.js) is based on upstream project [retire.js](https://github.com/RetireJS/retire.js), which doesn't handle local dependencies.

[retire.js](https://github.com/RetireJS/retire.js) relies on the [read-installed](https://github.com/npm/read-installed) to retrieve package information, but `read-installed` skips local packages, and `getNodeDependencies` emits an error because `notInstalled.length > 0` is true. See [node/lib/resolve.js](https://github.com/RetireJS/retire.js/blob/1aba081b5d5363add13710edeb470d5eb4f3c914/node/lib/resolve.js#L62) and [read-installed.js#L175](https://github.com/npm/read-installed/blob/master/read-installed.js#L175).

[quoting @ifrenkel](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/33323#note_336859655):

> there seems to be discussion about replacing `read-installed`: https://github.com/RetireJS/retire.js/issues/241#issuecomment-404292287
>
> `retire.js` used to have a more robust method of figuring out installed dependencies (`npm` itself) but was replaced because of the bloat of using `npm`: https://github.com/RetireJS/retire.js/issues/16

### Permissions and Security

- [ ] Add a local dependencies to [tests/js-npm](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/tests/js-npm), and make sure QA passes.

### Documentation

- [ ] Dependency Scanning docs say there's a limitation when `Referencing local dependencies using a path in JavaScript projects`, and this limitation needs to be removed. See https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/31844.

### Availability & Testing

N/A

### What does success look like, and how can we measure that?

Users can run Dependency Scanning on npm projects having local dependencies, and get vulnerability findings.

### What is the type of buyer?

~"GitLab Ultimate" 

### Is this a cross-stage feature?

No.

### Links / references

/cc @ifrenkel @gonzoyumo @NicoleSchwartz

title: JIRA integration doesn't use the authentication for the proxy provided .
description:
### Summary

One of our customers encountered a `Net::HTTPServerException (407 "Proxy Authentication Required"):` when trying JIRA integration. It seems that they are using a proxy which requires authentication.

Looking at the `jira-ruby` entry in the [Gemfile](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/-/blob/master/Gemfile#L233), it seems that we are using `1.7`. Authentication support for proxy was added during the `1.8` release of the library: https://github.com/sumoheavy/jira-ruby/pull/333

### Steps to reproduce

1. Setup a proxy server with authentication.
1. Configure GitLab to use that proxy.
1. Try to setup JIRA integration.

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Returns a `Net::HTTPServerException (407 "Proxy Authentication Required"):`.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Connects to JIRA properly.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

```
  "exception.class": "Net::HTTPServerException",
  "exception.message": "407 \"Proxy Authentication Required\"",
  "exception.backtrace": [
    "lib/gitlab/http.rb:24:in `perform_request'",
    "lib/gitlab/jira/http_client.rb:44:in `public_send'",
    "lib/gitlab/jira/http_client.rb:44:in `make_request'",
    "lib/gitlab/jira/http_client.rb:13:in `request'",
    "app/models/project_services/jira_service.rb:223:in `block in test_settings'",
    "app/models/project_services/jira_service.rb:361:in `jira_request'",
    "app/models/project_services/jira_service.rb:223:in `test_settings'",
    "app/models/project_services/jira_service.rb:196:in `test'",
    "app/controllers/projects/services_controller.rb:60:in `service_test_response'",
    "app/controllers/projects/services_controller.rb:46:in `test'",
    "ee/lib/gitlab/ip_address_state.rb:10:in `with'",
    "ee/app/controllers/ee/application_controller.rb:43:in `set_current_ip_address'",
    "app/controllers/application_controller.rb:479:in `set_current_admin'",
    "lib/gitlab/session.rb:11:in `with_session'",
    "app/controllers/application_controller.rb:470:in `set_session_storage'",
    "app/controllers/application_controller.rb:464:in `set_locale'",
    "lib/gitlab/error_tracking.rb:48:in `with_context'",
    "app/controllers/application_controller.rb:559:in `sentry_context'",
    "lib/gitlab/application_context.rb:52:in `block in use'",
    "lib/gitlab/application_context.rb:52:in `use'",
    "lib/gitlab/application_context.rb:20:in `with_context'",
    "app/controllers/application_controller.rb:455:in `set_current_context'",
    "ee/lib/gitlab/jira/middleware.rb:19:in `call'"
  ],
```

### Possible fixes

Update `jira-ruby` to at least `1.8`.

### Customer info

- https://gitlab.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/156019 (internal)
- https://gitlab.my.salesforce.com/0016100000NmTfNAAV

### Items

- [ ] Update `JiraService` to use the proxy options. ~backend https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/55406 https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/56679
- [ ] Store the proxy options from the UI. ~frontend ~backend

title: QRTLY COTERMS .COM: Create Static "Seats Currently in Use Members List" for GitLab.com (Frontend)
description:
## Notes:

1. The ~backend issue for this MVC found here: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/216996
1. This issue is an MVC of the desired implementation found here: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/27074

___

## MVC Proposal

On the parent group billing page, beneath the current subscription table, create a list of members who tie to the `Seats currently in use value`.

This has to be under the `api_billable_member_list` feature flag.

### In the table include:

1. Member Name (first, last)
1. Username
1. ~~Email address - only display when the member has elected to display the email address publicly. (see example screenshot below)~~ UPDATE: email address will not be included in this iteration but will be addressed in a follow-up iteration.
1. ~~IP~~ _we should not serve up this information per legal_
1. This information will only be accessible by members of the parent group with `owner` permissions

### Rules

1. 20 members per page
1. Only display a member once if they are members of multiple subgroups/projects
1. Display only billable members. Exclude GitLab generated bots (Support Bot, Alert Bot), Ghost Users, and Users with Guest permissions if the namespace subscribes to the Gold plan.
1. Include members invited from shared groups as long as they meet the conditions in rule 2.
1. The data should be updated dynamically as changes to the members in the instance are made. If this is too draining, let's update once a day and include a hover text which states that the table is updated at xx:xx time daily (including the timezone).

### Documentation

Would need to update:

- [Groups docs](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/group/), currently has nothing on Members list in general, only [adding users to group](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/group/#add-users-to-a-group)

### What does success look like, and how can we measure that?

- Group owners can match their subscription user count to the group members list via UI.

### Additional information

Only display email if the user has elected to publicly display it:

![Screen_Shot_2020-05-18_at_8.42.16](/uploads/8979b2233760992720ea7d7b365b425a/Screen_Shot_2020-05-18_at_8.42.16.png)

## ROI

* [ ] IACV 
* [ ] Cost Reduction
* [x] Sales Efficiency: [$50k in first 90-days post implementation](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1fLu95rdXLa1Y9zq5oI86AAneVsdMctB7NA7EAb7UgLM/edit?usp=sharing)
* [ ] Other
* [x] Support Efficiency

## TODOs 
- [x] New route - set it up
- [x] User count per page - agree on number (ATM 20 is the consensus - discussion [here](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/216899#note_425573777))
- [x] Billings table uses daily snapshot data / Seats table uses live data - [discussion here](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/216899#note_425585369)
  - [x] Add explanatory text about this (consensus ATM on *The table data is refreshed live. This contrasts with the billing table, which refreshes once per day.* - [discussion here](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/216899#note_426198120))
- [ ] When the table is on the bottom of the billing page, it conditionally shows only if there are billable users. However, when the table is on its own page, it needs to always show up and just show an empty state if there are no users.([discussion here](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/216899#note_425759222))
- [x] Put the feature under the feature flag `api_billable_member_list`
- [ ] Tests
- [ ] MR that removes the feature flag
- [ ] Docs
- [ ] Open follow-ups
  - [x] Add email
  - [ ] (?) Add endpoint for getting only the total number of seats, without getting any extra info in the payload (e.g. `hasBillableMembers`)

title: FY21-Q2 IACV - UX :: Make it easier to remove labels from issues
description:
<!-- The first four sections: "Problem to solve", "Intended users", "User experience goal", and "Proposal", are strongly recommended, while the rest of the sections can be filled out during the problem validation or breakdown phase. However, keep in mind that providing complete and relevant information early helps our product team validate the problem and start working on a solution. -->

### Problem to solve
Currently, when attempting to remove a label from an issue the following steps must take place:
1. Select "edit" in the sidebar  
2. Search/browse for the specific label   
3. Select the label
4. Deselect the search box to remove the label from the UI

<!-- What problem do we solve? Try to define the who/what/why of the opportunity as a user story. For example, "As a (who), I want (what), so I can (why/value)." -->

### Intended users
* [Parker (Product Manager)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#parker-product-manager)
* [Delaney (Development Team Lead)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#delaney-development-team-lead)

<!-- Who will use this feature? If known, include any of the following: types of users (e.g. Developer), personas, or specific company roles (e.g. Release Manager). It's okay to write "Unknown" and fill this field in later.

Personas are described at https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/
-->

### User experience goal
Reduce friction in the user's flow by minimizing the steps required to do this simple task.

[Parker (Product Manager)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#parker-product-manager)
```
When I am refining an issue by applying appropriate labels.

I want to remove some labels.

So I can ensure the issue appears in the correct filters.
```

[Delaney (Development Team Lead)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#delaney-development-team-lead)
```
When I am setting the status of an issue.

I want to remove a workflow label.

So I can make sure the status of the issue is clear to Parker [Parker (Product Manager)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#parker-product-manager).
```

### Proposals
(This design is based off of the [proposal here](https://www.figma.com/proto/QLoiWtw0Qt6HDudHViFPCH/remove-labels?node-id=57%3A4&scaling=min-zoom)) 

| Current | Solution |
| ------ | ------ |
| ![Current](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/uploads/d3c1d5261c794347f3ede38f836a5fe8/Current.png) | ![Screen_Recording_2020-06-16_at_11.24.51_AM](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/uploads/270434bfd456f81907870df660c278d1/Screen_Recording_2020-06-16_at_11.24.51_AM.mov)|

Please use the [Pajamas token specs for size of the X](https://www.figma.com/file/qEddyqCrI7kPSBjGmwkZzQ/Pajamas-UI-Kit?node-id=425%3A141). 

### Is this a cross-stage feature?

Yes. The ability to more easily remove labels will also appear on Merge Requests.

### Links / references
1. [Show applied labels at the top](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/17361) to at least reduce the need to browse the list
1. Remove filter functionality on-click and instead make a click disassociate the label from that issue. (Would need to understand: Is it really adding value to make the label's on-click functionality take the user to a new screen that shows all issues filtered by that label? This would be changing an existing user pattern to a very different flow. What is the expectation on the user's part for clicking on labels within issues?)
1. Display an X-to-remove or single [click removal process](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/33379)

### Release Notes

Removing a label from an Issue is a pretty clunky workflow that requires three clicks, fetching a fresh list of labels from the server, and using a search box to find the label you want to remove. Not only is this unintuitive, it's not efficient given labels are removed from Issues approximately 55,000 times per day costing the wider community over 900 minutes of precious time. It may not be [revolutionary](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/values/#boring-solutions), but you can now remove an Issue's label with a single click. 

https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/labels.html#assign-and-unassign-labels

title: FY21-Q2 IACV - UX :: Sticky Issue Titles
description:
<!-- The first four sections: "Problem to solve", "Intended users", "User experience goal", and "Proposal", are strongly recommended, while the rest of the sections can be filled out during the problem validation or breakdown phase. However, keep in mind that providing complete and relevant information early helps our product team validate the problem and start working on a solution. -->

### Problem to solve

People can't see the issue title as they scroll through the issue. This causes them to lose track of the issue topic as they read through a long description, related issues/MRs, and the discussion threads.

<!-- What problem do we solve? Try to define the who/what/why of the opportunity as a user story. For example, "As a (who), I want (what), so I can (why/value)." -->

### Intended users

[Sasha (Software Developer)](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/marketing/product-marketing/roles-personas/#sasha-software-developer)

### User experience goal

```
When I am reading into a longer issue.

I want to know the title of the issue.

So I can keep track of the issue purpose.
```

### Proposal
* Title and status should display. Title should be 14px bold and when clicked, should take the user back to the top of the page  
(Note: There's a small jump the first time the header animates in, this is something weird with the prototype and not desired behavior. It should smoothly animate in/out as the scrolling occurs.)
![Screen_Recording_2020-05-21_at_7.38.08_AM](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/uploads/736c939cb2cc92b5bb131b8132428bcc/Screen_Recording_2020-05-21_at_7.38.08_AM.mov)

[Interactive prototype here](https://www.figma.com/proto/RYvHlkfd6JRmOZTzwiUadE/sh-prototype?node-id=72%3A8&viewport=-1105%2C171%2C0.26070594787597656&scaling=min-zoom)

### What does success look like, and how can we measure that?

Sasha should be able to keep track of the issue subject without having to scroll up to see it.

### Links / references

| Issue Name / Summary | Issue Link | Notes |
| ------ | ------ | ------ |
| UX: Sticky issue/merge request headers | https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-foss/-/issues/45859 |  |
| Show issue title when browsing through comments | https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/24018 |  |

### Parking Lot

Out of scope changes for this issue:
1. Edit button in sticky issue title region
1. Sticky navigation tabs in sticky issue title region
1. Other issuables (e.g., Epics and MRs)

title: Use timezones for Danger Reviewer Roulette implementation
description:
## What is the productivity problem to solve?

Reduce the [mean time to review](https://app.periscopedata.com/app/gitlab/572770/WIP---Development:-Cycle-Time?widget=7470169&udv=906713) and [mean time review to merge](https://app.periscopedata.com/app/gitlab/504639/Development-KPIs?widget=7438019&udv=0) for the GitLab project by using timezones for the the reviewer selection process. 

- Reviewer selection chart: https://app.periscopedata.com/app/gitlab/572770/WIP---Development:-Cycle-Time?widget=8331524&udv=906713
- Maintainer selection chart: https://app.periscopedata.com/app/gitlab/572770/WIP---Development:-Cycle-Time?widget=8331541&udv=906713

### Problem identification checklist

- [ ] The root cause of the problem is identified.
- [ ] The surface of the problem is as small as possible.

## What are the potential solutions?

1. Retrieve users' timezones from Slack (see https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/121583).
1. One of those two things:
   - Pick reviewers in my timezone to improve cycle-times between reviewers and authors
   - Extra-clever: Pick reviewers near the beginning of their workday regardless of their timezone<sup>1</sup>

- [ ] All potential solutions are listed.
- [ ] A solution has been chosen for the first iteration: `PUT THE CHOSEN SOLUTION HERE`

## Verify that the solution has improved the situation

<!--
Ideally, looking at the charts from the first part, we should see an improvement
after the implementation is merged/deployed/released.
-->

- [ ] The solution improved the situation.
  - If yes, check this box and close the issue. Well done! :tada:
  - Otherwise, create a new "Productivity Improvement" issue. You can re-use the description from this issue, but obviously another solution should be chosen this time.

/cc @gl-quality/eng-prod

----

<sup>1</sup> Picking reviewers near the beginning of their day would allow the shortest possible turnaround time between author and reviewer **on the first cycle only.** Further back-and-forth could have just as long of a cycle time (depending on who is chosen). The utility of this solution depends on whether the most common number of review cycles is ~1 or >1.

title: Snippets Author can't be blank error
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "regression" or "bug" label:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=regression
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=bug

and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

When **Default snippet visibility** is set to an option that is disabled in **Restricted visibility levels**, no radio button is selected by default on the `/snippets/new` page when the user is **not** an **admin**.

gitlab-org/gitlab-foss#39979 also detailed this, but is closed.

Reference [internal ticket](https://gitlab.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/156097)

### Steps to reproduce

1. Go to **Admin -> Settings -> General**.
1. Click Expand for **Visibility and access controls**.
1. Change **Default snippet visibility** to one of the available options.
1. Change **Restricted visibility levels** to match the option set in **Default snippet visibility** in the previous step.
1. Login or impersonate a **non admin** user.
1. Go to `/snippets/new`.
1. Enter test data.
1. Click **Create snippet** without checking the visibility level. Therefore leaving the radio buttons unchecked.

### Example Project

Unable to replicate on GitLab.com. Seems limited to self-managed.

### What is the current *bug* behavior?
When **Visibility level** radio button is unchecked and **Create snippet** is clicked while on the page `/snippets/new`, an error is displayed in the UI.

`The form contains the following error:
Author can't be blank`

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

Either the error message should indicate an appropriate error, such as `Select a Visibility Level`, or a different radio button should default to checked in that case.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![visibility levels](/uploads/3b12820e5906fc817a762493a35788bd/78F569AD-0167-47FA-8DB3-D86C91B277AC.jpeg)

![New snippet](/uploads/cd9e17611eded76a694cfc686171d405/98B63611-A1CB-4E5A-8844-50547B4EC889.jpeg)

### Output of checks

(If you are reporting a bug on GitLab.com, write: This bug happens on GitLab.com)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Issues that we want to do but are not planned right now. Open for contribution from the community.

title: [BE][GraphQL] Ensure mutation code is consistent with API styleguide
description:
Any error conventions we follow should be reflected in our code. 

Specifically, our standard is that we should encourage [errors-as-data](https://github.com/rmosolgo/graphql-ruby/blob/master/guides/mutations/mutation_errors.md) and enforce the following invariants:

- all mutation responses have a field named `errors`, which returns a list of errors (actual type of error is mutation dependent)
- we *may* return errors alongside payloads. This should be indicated.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Issues that we want to do but are not planned right now. Open for contribution from the community.

title: Invite users to contribute to translations
description: ## Problem to Solve For many languages, there are not enough translations to Switch the UI to that language. Some languages lack proofreaders. Some languages were translated by translators who are not GitLab users, which leads to lesser quality translations. ## Proposed Solution There seems to be an untapped source of translations - GitLab users who are using non-English UI. Currently, we have 10k+ users who selected French, German, Japanese (and few others), but only a handful of contributing translators. Depending on a user's language preference, invite them to contribute to translations. The invite could be tailored to each language, such as finding users who would vote up/down existing translations in languages that have a high number of translations, but not many proofreaders. We can also add this invitation whenever we end up asking for feedback on the translation into a specific language. ### MVC Solution Put a link on https://gitlab.com/-/profile/preferences under "Localization": ``` This feature is experimental and translations are not complete yet. Help translate GitLab to your language. ``` ### Alternative Solution An alternative solution was proposed in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/352410. ## Implementation Guide Implement the **MVC Solution**, as described above. * [ ] Add `Help translate GitLab to your language.` to https://gitlab.com/-/profile/preferences, under `Localization` * [ ] Externalize the string `Help translate GitLab to your language.`

title: Geo: Form fields discussion
description:
## Context

Hi @geo-team, I would like to get your feedback on the possible value for each form on Geo UI.
It seems like we don't have a strict rule for each form field as a limitation.

If we could set the rule, it would be very helpful to make some progress on this issue https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/213732.

## Rules on forms

### Editing a primary node

![Screenshot_2020-05-06_at_17.36.31](/uploads/383c1a31c9a5b9bf77a3c1a652d3471f/Screenshot_2020-05-06_at_17.36.31.png)

| Input type | Field name | Possible value range | Default value |
| ------ | ------ | ------ | ------ | 
| Text | Node name | Max characters: `255` | - |
| Text | URL |  Max characters: `255` | - | 
| Text | Internal URL | Max characters: `255` | - | 
| Number | Verification capacity (number of jobs) | `1-999` | 100 |  
| Number | Re-verification interval (in days) | `1-9999` :nerd: | 7 | 


### Creating & Editing secondary nodes

![Screenshot_2020-05-06_at_17.36.42](/uploads/44e4582e7e440133b0f23b8dc90808b2/Screenshot_2020-05-06_at_17.36.42.png)

| Input type | Field name | Possible value range | Default value | 
| ------ | ------ | ------ | ------ | 
| Text | Node name | Max characters: `255` | - |
| Text | URL |  Max characters: `255` | - |
| Number | Repository synchronization capacity (number of jobs)  | `1-999` | 25 |
| Number | File synchronization capacity (number of jobs)  | `1-999`| 10 |
| Number | Container repositories synchronization capacity (number of jobs)| `1-999` | 10 |
| Number | Verification capacity (number of jobs) | `1-999`| 100 | 


### Settings

![Screenshot_2020-05-06_at_17.36.50](/uploads/9b56b24447eb117fc68496c5f3104372/Screenshot_2020-05-06_at_17.36.50.png)

| Input type | Field name | Possible value range | Default value |
| ------ | ------ | ------ | ------ |
| Number | Connection timeout (in seconds) | `1-120` | 10  |
| Text | Allowed Geo IP | `IP format` | `0.0.0.0/0, ::/0` |

## Questions

- Are numbers on `capacity` fields are in seconds? Then what could be the right range (minimum-maximum) for those fields?
- What could be a reasonable range for the timeout on the settings page?

## References

- [Tuning Geo documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/administration/geo/replication/tuning.html#changing-the-sync-capacity-values)
- [Geo node API documentation](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/geo_nodes.html#create-a-new-geo-node)
